transcript.title: PM 90/1962 - Swearing-in of Administrator
transcript.content:
P. M. No. 90/ 1962

The PrimeÂ Minister, Mr. Menzies, announced thisÂ evening that His Excellency General Sir Dallas Brooks,Â Governor of Victoria, who holds a dormant Commission fromÂ Her Majesty The Queen, will be sworn in as AdministratorÂ of the Government of the Commonwealth of Australia atÂ Government House, Melbourne, tomorrow, Wednesday, 21stÂ November, 1962 at 12.30 pm. The prescribed oaths will beÂ administered by the Chief Justice of the High Court ofÂ Australia, the Rt. Hon. Sir Owen Dixon, in the presence ofÂ the Rt. Hon. John McEwen, Deputy Prime Minister and MinisterÂ for Trade, The Leader of the Opposition, the Hon. ArthurÂ Calwell, and Commonwealth Ministers will also attend.

Sir Dallas Brooks will act as AdministratorÂ during the short period that His Excellency the Governor-General is absent from Australia.

CANBERRA,
20 November, 1962.
